citation.article-title: Halobacillus dabanensis sp. nov. and Halobacillus aidingensis sp. nov., isolated from salt lakes in Xinjiang, China
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Halobacillus aidingensis sp. nov.
Halobacillus aidingensis (ai.ding.en′sis. N.L. masc. adj. aidingensis from Aiding salt lake, where the type strain was isolated).
Cells are club-shaped rods, 1·0–2·8×0·6–1·2 μm.
Gram-positive, occurring singly or in pairs (Fig. 1) and motile by means of peritrichous flagella.
Ellipsoidal endospores are located at a central or subterminal position.
Colonies are round, smooth, orange in colour, entire and 1–2 mm in diameter after incubation for 3 days.
Growth occurs in 0·5–20 % (w/v) NaCl with an optimum concentration of 10 % (w/v) NaCl.
The temperature range for growth is 15–40 °C; optimum temperature is 32 °C.
Growth occurs at pH 6–10; optimum pH is 7·5.
Acid is produced from d-fructose, d-glucose, d-trehalose, d-mannitol, maltose and sucrose but not from d-galactose and d-xylose.
Catalase, oxidase and DNase are produced, but urease is negative.
Starch, gelatin and casein are hydrolysed but tyrosine, aesculin and Tween 80 are not hydrolysed.
Phosphatase, lecithinase, phenylalanine deaminase and arginine dihydrolase are not produced.
The Voges–Proskauer test is negative.
Nitrate is not reduced to nitrite.
The cell-wall peptidoglycan type is l-orn–d-Asp.
The predominant menaquinone is MK-7.
The major cellular fatty acids are anteiso-C15 : 0, anteiso-C17 : 0, iso-C15 : 0 and iso-C16 : 0.
The DNA G+C content is 42·2 mol%.
The type strain, AD-6T (=JCM 12771T=CGMCC 1.3703T), was isolated from Aiding salt lake in Xinjiang region, China.
